intro: Mentha × poiretiana, commonly known as the woolly mint, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and square, branching stems. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Mentha × poiretiana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cooler climates. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and its use in aromatherapy and herbal remedies.
